page.title: 18LANDSCAPE
page.content: The overall picture that is obtained of the area is one of a very green and reasonably well wooded area.The woodland is concentrated in hardwood stands on the Hatton Grange Estate and on the ridges edging the study area. The remainder of the hardwood consists of single trees set in hedgerows and field boundaries.There is very little softwood planting in the area. The arera is remarkably flat with the only areas of high land being the ridges bounding the SE corner.The average height of the area is 80' with the ridges rising to 108'.There is also the valley of the Worfe which is cut down to 60'. The only barren areas in the study area are the spoil heaps which have come from the sand and gravel quarrying which is no longer continued along the northern edge of the area.
